data.text: @StuartDNeilson @FrancosBruvva A greater % of the population now have covid than before. Therefore when people die, a greater % would be expected to have covid. These are deaths with covid rather than deaths from covid. I wish people who don’t understand stats would stop spreading misinformation.
@StuartDNeilson You can’t get a Covid test now unless you pay 💰 that’s one way to keep the numbers down .

@mountbruis @StuartDNeilson Sorry to hear about your child but for the majority of people this is a non event. I had it myself. Its time to get on with living life and accepting there is an element of risk to everything we do instead of trying to wrap everything in cotton wool.

@mountbruis @Brian18946855 The INEVITABLE consequence of war is increased infection, with displacement of people into crowded settings, the disruption of sanitation systems & medical services, and mass migration.

@Brian18946855 @StuartDNeilson As you call it the " sniffles" 4 in my family and all have covid. 17 year old very sick and required steroids. Not just the sniffles for everyone. Not all cases are mild. Mine is mild and son & husband mild BUT my daughter is anything but mild

@StuartDNeilson @williamhboney1 I still wear my mask, even though restrictions have eased and will keep wearing it for as long as possible in all shops, supermarkets, public places and public transport.
@StuartDNeilson Its ok less testing equals less numbers equals pandemic cured. Happy days.
@NicolaJ61077232 @StuartDNeilson On what data basis is it not true? Can you post please?
@StuartDNeilson Don’t call me an idiot just because I don’t agree with your point of view. It’s childish.
